intro: Diphasia angolensis, commonly known as the Angola two-phase plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a distinctive arrangement. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
